item.title: Abandoned vehicle fire damaged, 23rd August
item.description:
Vehicle fire evening of 8/8/2025. Fire Brigade attended. Reported to county and borough councillor 9/8/2025. Reported to landowner of fence and land to rear as fence is badly damaged. Landowner notified police and they attended 11/08/2025. Vehicle is still there. This is a GCC owned lay-by. Please will GCC contact police and insurance company and get this removed asap. This lay-by is frequented by camper vans and restrictions should be placed on it - eg No Overnight Parking. This was an incident we knew would happen and could have been significantly worse if grass and gardens/shed etc had caught fire.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface along a large section of road appalling, 23rd August
item.description:
The surface of the road at the Salisbury Avenue end of farmfield Road and for a large stretch of the road is appalling. As the bus route is about to change and buses will no longer travel along that road, please can you look at resurfacing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Farmfield Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Amazing, 23rd August
item.description:
Yes... You fixed a large square around the drain cover - well done, but with a few feet is a another large pothole. You must have seen it. I despair at the sense of ignoring an equally large pothole, right next to the one your repaired. It just blows my mind...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Piffs Elm Road, Tewkesbury

item.title: Potholes and cracks opening up down the entire length of lane, 22nd August
item.description:
Wide cracks are opening up the entire length of the lane. The road is subsiding all the way down and is becoming hazardous to drive and cycle down. The issue has been worsening over a number of years and recent repairs have failed to address the problem. Damage to vehicles is likely

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The new cycle path here is shared, however I have personally nearly been knocked over by cyclists at high speed travelling on the inside of the pavement. The exit for pedestrians from Sandycroft Road is blind and the cyclist have no view of pedestrians to warn them with a bell. Can it please be possible to put a small sign on the pavement to indicate pedestrians to use the inner part of the pavement and cyclists the outer by the road like the rest of the cycle path. I feel that this is an accident waiting to happen. I am one of the few that actually agree with the implementation of the cycle path but this particular part is very dangerous., 22nd August
item.description:
Pedestrian path exiting Sandycroft Road to join the pavement at Cheltenham Road East.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sandycroft Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement
